It's quiet, peaceful, clean, and minimal in the best way! The kitchenette isn't meant for cooking Thanksgiving dinner (nor should it be!) - it's perfect for storing and preparing a few snacks/leftovers/drinks - exactly what you need on vacation! The upstairs is cozy and spotless. We slept like logs!
Since our trip was so short, we only saw Kathy and John once, but they were as kind as could be! I read another review where someone said bumping into them was like bumping into friends, and I totally get it!
There are goats, chickens, rabbits, and cats on the property, but I PROMISE you the shared spaces do not smell like animals, you don't hear them, and the place is so clean that you could almost forget they're there! Or, if you're like me, you can talk to them like a goober and maybe even pet a goat!

We enjoyed our stay at this quaint and peaceful farmhouse barn space. The place was very clean and the host answered all of our questions quickly, within minute, which we really appreciated!
The only heads up we would give is to families traveling with a young child that it will require some improvisation. For example, there wasn't a tub, so we did wipe downs with a wet washcloth for our kiddos. And since there wasn't a washer or dryer on site, so diaper accidents or spitups/vomit may also be something worth planning "worst case scenario" for. We handwashed a few linen in the sink and airdried it outside and that also worked well. There wasn't a highchair, so we fed baby in our lap. There wasn't a stove, so we had to think through meals and snacks carefully. Our littles loved the rooster crowing and it was a treat seeing the goats being fed!
Absolutely beautiful property, and we would definitely come stay here again next time we pass through.
Thank you, Ashley!

Annamarie’s barn conversion loft home was so easy to give 5-stars across the board!
I’ve stayed at plenty of AirBnBs in the past 10 years - this one is definitely one of my favorites.
Her and her husband did an outstanding job on this barn conversion. It was without a doubt an early 2020, COVID-season project that they spent a lot of time bringing together details and curating decor.
I found their barn-home by accident, after procrastination got the best of me and I missed the deadline to book a hotel room for my friends and I at a sponsored hotel for a wedding - this might be the only case where procrastinating has ever worked in my favor.
This AirBnB is a perfect setup for attending weddings/gatherings/events at the Four Seasons venue in Cardington. Door to door, it’s ~13 minutes. This ended up being about half an hour closer than our encouraged hotel that most everyone else attending the wedding for stayed at. It really couldn’t have worked out any better, and everyone was rather jealous of the convenience of our stay.
I had a single ‘loose negative’ (not even really a negative!) point for their barn-home until this morning. I drive a Tesla - I understood that there was no outdoor outlet for charging my car at the barn - and did not expect them! They were not advertised as being available, and I was prepared to drive half an hour or so to reach a Tesla Supercharger. Not the most convenient, but it’s not the hosts job to cater to every single possible situation. This morning in conversation with Annamarie and her husband before we left, they mentioned they’ll be adding an outlet for electric cars and RVs soon as they’ve been very common requests. They are constantly seeking ways to better serve their guests, and it shows.
If I ever find myself staying in this part of Ohio again, Annamarie’s barn-home is at the very top of my list of places to stay.

We read many glowing reviews of Terradise on Airbnb. Unfortunately, we were disappointed with the overall condition of the property and lack of cleanliness.
The weather was cool and beautiful, but many of the windows don't open and/or don't have screens. Many of the miniblinds do not properly operate. The carpet has many large stains and the house has a musty odor. The mattress in smaller bedroom is quite old and uncomfortable, the headboard was dusty and the baseboards were unclean.
Multiple rooms have paint and or wallpaper peeling. Several cabinets in kitchen are not securely attached.
The outside of the home is not well cared for. The steps to entry are pulling away from porch, the railings and banisters are loose, peeling paint, missing spindles. The gazebo is overgrown and unusable. Outdoor wooden chair had slats missing and exposed nails.
The host was responsive when we discovered a leak under kitchen sink and sent a plumber next morning to repair. David was kind enough to return rx glasses which I left behind.
I'm sure Terradise was once a beautiful home in a scenic location. It's sad to see the lack of maintenance and I'm sorry to say, we would not return.

review_text: Davids place is the best place I have ever stayed at for peace and quiet. I am retired Navy and travel a lot as I dive at several locations. No swimming pools or beaches here but the surroundings more then make up for that. The stream in the back is nice when its warmer as I use to fish in it during the1960-70s when I lived in Marion. Always caught several fish. The pond on the property looks like the only thing in it would be frogs but I took a chance and tried it out and was surprised by catching some nice bass. Of course catch and release only for other people to enjoy it. I saw some deer in the back yard on my first morning along with ducks and geese and soooo many other birds. The yard or should I just say the huge property has flowers every where. The inside of the home is filled with books on nature and Ohio history. I was born and raised in the Marion/Edison area and left in 1972 to join the Navy. I was reading in one of Trellas (original owner) books that she edited I found some of my family history from Edison. My grandfather owned a mill there and was a well known community member from Edison. Teeradise is an older (1952) home that has been well taken care of. Reminded me of staying at my grandparents home when I was a kid in Edison. If your a outdoors person or just love nature you will not find a better place. I have heard that changes are coming that may change how Teeradise is set up, like going away from airbnb and set up for classes on nature. I hope this does not come about. So if your planning to stay here make your reservation SOON.
